0.context: Charminar Architecture Serving as an iconic landmark to look forward to, Charminar is one of the most reckoned structures of all the historical places in India. It is indeed one of the places to visit in Hyderabad in 1 day for all travelers alike. The history of Charminar goes back to the 1500s. Originally built as a mosque, the glorious Charminar stands as an epitome of art and architecture in the heart of the city. Also, it is a must for food lovers to relish some of the best Hyderabad street food near Charminar. Here are the details about Charminar. This is amongst the best things to do in Hyderabad in winter. Location: Charkaman, Ghansi Bazaar, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002. Timings: Monday to Sunday, 9 AM to 5:30 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its striking Mughal architecture. Built By: Muhammad Quli Qutb Shahi. Built In: 1591 AD. Tip: It is best to visit the monument early in the morning. TripAdvisor Reviews.
0.summary: Charminar, located in Charkaman, Ghansi Bazaar, Hyderabad, is an iconic historical structure built in 1591 AD by Muhammad Quli Qutb Shahi. Known for its striking Mughal architecture, it's a must-visit landmark. Open from 9 AM to 5:30 PM daily, it's recommended to visit early in the morning to enjoy the site and nearby street food.

1.context: Golkonda Fort An Archeological Gem If you are looking for popular places in Hyderabad, you cannot miss Golkonda Fort. A treasure in the chest of Hyderabad, the Archaeological Survey of India considers the Golkonda Fort as an archaeological gem which is also one of the best night places to visit in Hyderabad. A former capital of the Qutb Shahi Dynasty, this citadel now serves as one of the famous picnic spots in Hyderabad. An architectural masterpiece of all times, it is a strict no-no to miss out on this fort of all the Hyderabad attractions. Location: Khair Complex, Ibrahim Bagh, Hyderabad. Timings: 9 AM to 5:30 PM Every day. Famous For: It is famous for its impenetrable structure. Built By: Sultan Quli. Built In: c. 1143. Tip: Do not miss the evening show when visiting the fort. TripAdvisor Reviews.
1.summary: Golkonda Fort, located in Khair Complex, Ibrahim Bagh, Hyderabad, is an archaeological gem and a former capital of the Qutb Shahi Dynasty. Known for its impenetrable structure, it was built around 1143 by Sultan Quli. Open daily from 9 AM to 5:30 PM, visitors shouldn't miss the evening show.

2.context: Mecca Masjid A Heritage Site A religious site by nature, Mecca or Makkah Masjid happens to be one of the oldest places to see in Hyderabad. Listed as one of the top heritage sites in India, the Masjid got its name after the bricks that were brought for construction from the famous city of Mecca in Saudi Arabia. Standing tall at a height of 23 meters, this fascinating Masjid is not only the most spectacular place to visit in Hyderabad, India but also one of the largest mosques in India. Location: Near Charminar, Ghansi Bazaar, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002. Timings: 4 AM to 9:30 PM. Famous For: This is the holiest site of Islam. Built By: Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah. Built In: 1693. Tip: Carry a bag to keep your footwear as you can’t wear them inside the Masjid. TripAdvisor Reviews.
2.summary: Mecca Masjid, located near Charminar in Ghansi Bazaar, Hyderabad, is one of the oldest and largest mosques in India. Built in 1693 by Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah, it's named after bricks from Mecca. Open from 4 AM to 9:30 PM, visitors should carry a bag for footwear as shoes are not allowed inside.

3.context: Qutb Shahi Tombs Marvel at the Persian Architecture Located within the premises of Ibrahim Bagh, the Qutb Shahi Tombs are one of the most historical places in Hyderabad as they house the tombs of all the seven rulers of the Qutb Shahi Dynasty. Casting a magical spell on the visitors with its grandeur, travelers will surely be charmed to witness the tombs that strike a perfect balance between the Indian and Persian style of architecture. Location: Qutub Shahi Tombs, Hyderabad, Telangana 500008. Timings: Saturday to Thursday, 9:30 AM to 4:30 PM (Closed on Fridays). Entry Fee: INR 5 Per Child, INR 10 Per Adult, INR 20 Per Camera. Famous For: It is famous for its architecture. Built By: Qutb Shahi. Built In: 1550 A.D. Tip: Do not forget to carry your cameras along to capture the beauty of these structures. TripAdvisor Reviews.
3.summary: Qutb Shahi Tombs, located in Ibrahim Bagh, Hyderabad, house the tombs of the seven Qutb Shahi rulers. Built in 1550 AD, these tombs exhibit a blend of Indian and Persian architecture. Open from Saturday to Thursday, 9:30 AM to 4:30 PM, with an entry fee of INR 5 for children, INR 10 for adults, and INR 20 for cameras.

4.context: Hussain Sagar Lake Mesmerizing Views Considered to be one of the largest lakes in the heart of the city, Hussain Sagar Lake is one of the most romantic places to visit in Hyderabad city for couples. Other than offering majestic views of the massive Buddha statue located in the middle of the lake, one can also enjoy boating and parasailing activities that also make it one of the most happening places to visit in Hyderabad at night. Location: 2 kms from the Hyderabad Center, Hyderabad, Telangana. Timings: Tuesdays to Sundays, 9 AM to 9 PM (Closed on Mondays). Entry Fee: INR 5 per person. Boat Transfers: INR 30 for adults and INR 20 for children. Famous For: It is famous for being the largest artificial lake in Asia. Built By: Ibrahim Quli Qutb Shah. Built In: 1563. Tip: This lake is easily accessible by the local public transport. TripAdvisor Reviews.
4.summary: Hussain Sagar Lake, located 2 km from Hyderabad Center, is the largest artificial lake in Asia, built in 1563 by Ibrahim Quli Qutb Shah. Known for its Buddha statue, it offers boating and parasailing. Open from 9 AM to 9 PM (closed on Mondays), with an entry fee of INR 5 and boat transfers costing INR 30 for adults and INR 20 for children.

5.context: Ramoji Film City Paradise for Movie Buffs Ever heard that big surprises come in small packages? Well, Ramoji Film City sure does live up to that expression. It not only is one of the famous tourist places in Hyderabad but also holds a Guinness World Book Record for being home to more than 50 film sets at a single location. Did you know that before? The price for Ramoji film city ticket is INR 1150 for adults and INR 950 for kids. Location: Anaspur Village, Hayathnagar Mandal, Hyderabad. Timings: Monday to Sunday, 9 AM to 5:30 PM. Famous For: It is famous for being the world’s biggest film studio. Built By: Ramoji Rao. Built In: 1996. Tip: Make sure you are going with a group of friends or family. TripAdvisor Reviews.
5.summary: Ramoji Film City, located in Anaspur Village, Hayathnagar Mandal, Hyderabad, is the world's biggest film studio, built in 1996 by Ramoji Rao. Home to over 50 film sets, it's open from 9 AM to 5:30 PM daily. Tickets cost INR 1150 for adults and INR 950 for kids. It's best enjoyed with a group of friends or family.

6.context: Nehru Zoological Park Befriend Various Species A home to about 1500 odd animals across various species, Nehru Zoological Park is one of the must-visit attractions on a Hyderabad city tour. Spread across an area of about 380 acres, it also happens to be one of the largest zoos in India. Surprised much? Location: Zoo Park Main Road, Kishan Bagh, Bahadurpura, Hyderabad. Timings: Tuesdays to Sunday, 8:30 AM to 4:30 PM (Closed on Mondays). Entry Fee: INR 20 per adult, INR 10 per child, INR 20 per still camera, INR 100 per video camera, INR 500 for professional shoots, and INR 1000 per car or jeep. Famous For: It is famous for being the first masonry dam in the entire world. Built By: Government of Telangana. Built In: 1963. Tip: Make sure you plan your visit in a way that you are able to spend at least 3 to 4 hours here. TripAdvisor Reviews.
6.summary: Nehru Zoological Park, located in Kishan Bagh, Bahadurpura, Hyderabad, is one of India's largest zoos, spread over 380 acres. Open from 8:30 AM to 4:30 PM (closed on Mondays), entry costs INR 20 for adults, INR 10 for children, with additional fees for cameras and professional shoots. Visitors should plan to spend 3 to 4 hours here.

7.context: Snow World Have Some Snowy Fun Considered to be one of the top Hyderabad attractions, Snow World is a unique amusement park located in the heart of the city and right next to Hussain Sagar Lake. Spread across a land of about 2 acres, Snow World promises a day amidst the snow for friends, families, and all travelers alike. The Snow World ticket price is INR 500 onwards. Location: Survey No. 57, Lower Tank Bund Road, Near Lake View Hotel, Hyderabad, Telangana 500080. Timings: Monday to Sunday, 11 AM to 8 PM. Famous For: It is famous for giving one a chance to play around in snow throughout the year in the central region of the country. Built By: Nitish Roy. Built In: 2004. Tip: If you are skiing, make sure there is enough gap between you and the person in front. TripAdvisor Reviews.
7.summary: Snow World, located on Lower Tank Bund Road near Lake View Hotel, Hyderabad, is a unique amusement park built in 2004 by Nitish Roy. Spread over 2 acres, it offers snow activities year-round. Open daily from 11 AM to 8 PM, tickets start at INR 500. Skiers should ensure a safe distance between themselves and others.

8.context: Lumbini Park Refresh Your Senses A modern urban park located at the core of the city, Lumbini Park is one of the refreshing night places to visit in Hyderabad for couples. Letting the locals unwind after a tiring day and entertaining the travelers with the magical light and sound show, the park is dedicated to Lord Buddha and is named after Lumbini of Nepal. Location: Opposite Secretariat New Gate, Khairatabad, Hyderabad, Telangana 500004. Timings: Monday to Sunday, 9 AM to 9 PM. Laser Show Timings: Weekdays 7:15 PM, Weekends 7:15 PM and 8:30 PM. Famous For: It is famous for being a perfect spot to relax and enjoy the tranquil surroundings. Built By: Hyderabad Urban Development Authority. Built In: 1994. Tip: You can skip the queues and opt for buying tickets online. TripAdvisor Reviews.
8.summary: Lumbini Park, located opposite Secretariat New Gate in Khairatabad, Hyderabad, is a modern urban park built in 1994 by the Hyderabad Urban Development Authority. Open from 9 AM to 9 PM daily, it offers a light and sound show on weekdays at 7:15 PM and on weekends at 7:15 PM and 8:30 PM. It's a great spot for relaxation.

9.context: Birla Mandir Seek Solace Spread across a land that measures about 13 acres and perched high on a hill at a height of around 280 feet, Birla Mandir is one of the famous religious places to visit in Hyderabad in 2 days. Popular amongst the Hindu population and all travelers across the country, it is set on a hillock called Naubat Pahad and was inaugurated by Swami Ranganathananda himself who runs the Ramakrishna Mission. Location: Hill Fort Rd, Ambedkar Colony, Khairatabad, Hyderabad, Telangana 500004. Timings: Monday to Sunday, 7 AM to 12 PM, 3 PM to 9 PM. Famous For: It is famous for being home to the replica of the idol of Balaji in Tirupati. Built By: G.D. Birla. Built In: 1976. Tip: Since it’s a temple, it is advised to go fully clothed. Avoid shorts, skirts, and tank tops. TripAdvisor Reviews.
9.summary: Birla Mandir, located on Hill Fort Rd, Ambedkar Colony, Khairatabad, Hyderabad, is a famous religious site built in 1976 by G.D. Birla. Spread across 13 acres and perched 280 feet high on Naubat Pahad, it houses a replica of the Balaji idol from Tirupati. Open from 7 AM to 12 PM and 3 PM to 9 PM daily, visitors should dress modestly.

10.context: Salar Jung Museum A National Treasure Renowned to be one of the largest and one amongst the only three National Museums in India, Salar Jung Museum is one of the best places to visit in Hyderabad that is dedicated to every form of art. Enjoying a favored location at Darushifa, this popular museum is set on the banks of River Musi and is home to paintings, sculptures, manuscripts, carvings, artifacts, and lots more from all over the world. Location: Salar Jung Road, Near Minar Function Hall, Darulshifa, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002. Timings: Saturday to Thursday, 10 AM to 5 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its collection of carpets, sculptures, ceramics, ancient manuscripts, and textiles. Built By: Mir Yousuf Ali Khan. Built In: 16 December 1951. Tip: Do not touch anything as these artifacts have been preserved for centuries now. TripAdvisor Reviews.
10.summary: Salar Jung Museum, located on Salar Jung Road near Minar Function Hall in Darulshifa, Hyderabad, is one of India's largest national museums. Built by Mir Yousuf Ali Khan and opened in 1951, it features an extensive collection of art, including paintings, sculptures, manuscripts, and more. Open from 10 AM to 5 PM, Saturday to Thursday, visitors should refrain from touching the preserved artifacts.

11.context: Nehru Centenary Tribal Museum Cultural Mirror Portraying the beauty of different cultures, traditions, customs, and lifestyle of the various local tribes of Andhra Pradesh, the Nehru Centenary Tribal Museum is one of those Hyderabad attractions that unites all the locals of the city. While Hill Reddy, Bagata, and Kondareddy are some of the main tribes that are being represented here, the museum is one of the best places to visit in Hyderabad to learn more about the heritage and history of Hyderabad and its people. Location: Owaisi Pura, Masab Tank, Hyderabad, Telangana 500028. Timings: Monday to Saturday, 10 AM to 5 PM. Famous For: It is famous for showcasing everything one needs to know about indigenous tribes. Built By: NA. Built In: NA. Tip: Photography is not allowed inside the museum, so do not carry cameras. TripAdvisor Reviews.
11.summary: Nehru Centenary Tribal Museum, located in Owaisi Pura, Masab Tank, Hyderabad, showcases the cultures, traditions, and lifestyles of Andhra Pradesh's local tribes. Open from Monday to Saturday, 10 AM to 5 PM, it offers insight into the heritage and history of Hyderabad's people. Photography is not allowed inside the museum.

12.context: Chowmahalla Palace Adorned with Grandeur As it is popularly known as Chowmahallatuu among the locals, the fascinating Chowmahalla Palace is undoubtedly one of the best places to visit in Hyderabad for couples that manifests the real essence of Nizam’s culture. Having served as the royal residence of the Nizams and the royal seat of Asaf Jahi Dynasty in the bygone era, the Chowmahalla Palace is one of the most famous palaces in India. It continues to impress travelers with its grandeur and rich historical past. Location: Motigalli, Khilwat, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002. Timings: Saturday to Thursday, 10 AM to 5 PM (Closed on Fridays). Famous For: It got its fame as the seat of the rulers of the Asaf Jahi dynasty. Built By: Nizam Salabat Jung. Built In: 1750. Tip: Food is not allowed inside the park. There is a small canteen outside the Palace. TripAdvisor Reviews.
12.summary: Chowmahalla Palace, located in Motigalli, Khilwat, Hyderabad, was the royal residence of the Nizams and the seat of the Asaf Jahi Dynasty. Built in 1750 by Nizam Salabat Jung, it showcases the grandeur and rich history of Nizam's culture. Open from Saturday to Thursday, 10 AM to 5 PM (closed on Fridays), food is not allowed inside, but there's a canteen outside.

13.context: NTR Gardens A Lush Escapade Of all the places to visit in Hyderabad, NTR Gardens is comparatively a newer addition to the family of tourist attractions in the city. Dedicated and built in memory of Late Shri N.T. Rama Rao, a visit to the lush NTR Gardens is a must for those who are in search of a place to revive their mind, body, and soul. Location: NTR Marg, Central Secretariat, Khairatabad, Hyderabad. Timings: Monday to Sunday, 24 Hours. Entry Fee: INR 15 per adult, INR 10 per child, INR 30 per camera, INR 65 per video camera. Famous For: It is famous for being a memorial for former chief minister Late Shri N.T. Rama Rao. Built By: Government of Andhra Pradesh. Built In: 2002. Tip: Do not indulge in plucking any flowers from the garden. TripAdvisor Reviews.
13.summary: NTR Gardens, located on NTR Marg, Central Secretariat, Khairatabad, Hyderabad, is a lush park built in 2002 by the Government of Andhra Pradesh in memory of Late Shri N.T. Rama Rao. Open 24 hours daily, it has an entry fee of INR 15 for adults, INR 10 for children, INR 30 per camera, and INR 65 per video camera. Visitors should refrain from plucking flowers.

14.context: Shilparamam Idyllic Village A quaint little village, Shilparamam is one of the best tourist places in Hyderabad, dedicated to arts, handicrafts, and culture. Putting up a lot of cultural and traditional shows for the visitors and all travelers, Shilparamam is built on a village theme which also houses a museum as well as a lake inside. Also, for when you visit this gorgeous attraction, do not miss out on treating your taste buds to authentic Awadhi cuisines at Sahib’s Barbeque, one of the best restaurants in Hyderabad. Location: Jubilee Enclave, Hitech City, Near Cyber Towers, Hyderabad, Telangana 500081. Timings: Monday to Sunday, 10:30 AM to 8 PM. Entry Fee: INR 40 per adult, INR 20 per child, INR 30 per person for boating, INR 15 per person for cars. Famous For: It is famous for shopping, not only among locals but also tourists. Built By: NA. Built In: 1998. Tip: Make sure you practice your bargaining skills before heading for shopping. TripAdvisor Reviews.
14.summary: Shilparamam, located in Jubilee Enclave, Hitech City, Hyderabad, is a village-themed tourist spot dedicated to arts, handicrafts, and culture. Built in 1998, it features cultural shows, a museum, and a lake. Open daily from 10:30 AM to 8 PM, entry fees are INR 40 for adults, INR 20 for children, INR 30 per person for boating, and INR 15 per person for cars. Practice bargaining skills before shopping.

15.context: Jalavihar A Splash of Fun One of the most visited places in Hyderabad located at the Necklace Road, Jalavihar is one of the popular and best water parks in Hyderabad which is a perfect place for families and kids. It has varied options for entertainment within its boundaries. From water rides like the Mini Aqua Trailers and Tilt bucket to the various options of dry rides, this place makes a great place to head towards with kids. Jalavihar ticket price is INR 350 per person. Location: Necklace Road, Hussain Sagar, Hyderabad, Telangana 500063. Timings: 11 AM to 7 PM Open Daily. Famous For: It is famous among kids who wish to beat the summer heat in Hyderabad. Built By: N.V. Rama Raju. Built In: 20 May 2007. Tip: Make sure you have nylon swimming costumes to enter the water park. TripAdvisor Reviews.
15.summary: Jalavihar, located on Necklace Road, Hussain Sagar, Hyderabad, is a popular water park for families and kids. Built by N.V. Rama Raju in 2007, it offers various water and dry rides. Open daily from 11 AM to 7 PM, tickets cost INR 350 per person. Nylon swimming costumes are required for entry.

16.context: Birla Planetarium Fusion of Entertainment & Science Birla Planetarium ranks among the most modern planetariums in the country, located at the Naubat Pahad in the heart of Hyderabad. Established in the year 1985, this is one of the popular sightseeing places in the city which is not only favorite amongst the children but also the adults. This was the first phase of the Birla Science center which was indeed a landmark in terms of innovation and bridging the gap between common masses and science. Location: Near Birla Temple, Ambedkar Colony, Hyderabad, Telangana 500004. Timings: 10:30 AM to 8 PM. Famous For: It is famous for maintaining the international standards of presentation. Built By: P.A. Singaravelu. Built In: 1985. Tip: You can book your tickets online and save some time. TripAdvisor Reviews.
16.summary: Birla Planetarium, located near Birla Temple in Ambedkar Colony, Hyderabad, is a modern planetarium established in 1985 by P.A. Singaravelu. Open from 10:30 AM to 8 PM, it maintains international standards of presentation and is popular among both children and adults. Tickets can be booked online to save time.

17.context: Purani Haveli Exuding Royalty Purani Haveli is a beautifully built European-style architecture which was built in the 19th century by the Peshwa of Mohammed Quli Qutub Shah. It is crafted in a complex with only a single storied central building. One of the top places to visit in Hyderabad in 2 days, this heritage building was acquired by Asaf Jha II and in the 18th century, it was renovated by the Nizam of Hyderabad. Currently, this haveli is converted into a Nizam’s Museum where various artifacts are preserved. Location: Pathar Gatti, Near Princess Durru Shehvar Hospital, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002. Timings: 10:30 AM to 5 PM Daily except Friday. Entry Fee: INR 15 for children, INR 80 for adults. Famous For: It is famous for combining the European facades from the 18th century and the traditional Indian courtyards. Built By: Mir Momen. Built In: 16th century. Tip: Do not forget to carry your cameras along. TripAdvisor Reviews.
17.summary: Purani Haveli, located in Pathar Gatti near Princess Durru Shehvar Hospital, Hyderabad, is a 19th-century European-style architecture built by the Peshwa of Mohammed Quli Qutub Shah. Renovated by the Nizam of Hyderabad in the 18th century, it now serves as a museum. Open from 10:30 AM to 5 PM daily (except Fridays), entry fees are INR 15 for children and INR 80 for adults. Carry your cameras for capturing the beauty.

18.context: Laad Bazaar Vibrant Market Source: Situated close to Charminar, Laad Bazaar is a place famous for bangles and many other traditional items, making it a shopper’s paradise. Stretched across four roads that start from Charminar and spread across at least one kilometer, this market showcases the living heritage of the city. It is believed that this market has existed since the time of Qutub Shahis and the era of Nizams, and now it is one of the major places to shop bangles made of Lacquer or Laad, from where the name has been derived. It is arguably one of the most beautiful places in Hyderabad. Location: Char Kaman, Ghansi Bazaar, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002. Timings: 11 AM to 10:30 PM. Famous For: It is famous for an extensive variety of bangles. Built By: Mohammad Quli Qutub Shah. Built In: 16th century. Tip: Stop for photo ops at the Laad Bazaar. TripAdvisor Reviews.
18.summary: Laad Bazaar, located in Char Kaman, Ghansi Bazaar, Hyderabad, is a vibrant market famous for bangles and traditional items. Stretched across four roads starting from Charminar, it dates back to the Qutub Shahi and Nizam eras. Open from 11 AM to 10:30 PM, it is a shopper's paradise and a great spot for photo opportunities.

19.context: Durgam Cheruvu Serene Lake One of the best places to see in Hyderabad, Durgam Cheruvu is a hidden lake located just close to the city. The lake stands hidden between an amalgamation of granite rocks; hence this is also called the secret lake. Spread across an area of 63 acres, the lake is surrounded by many rocks which are around 2500 million years old. According to the locals, the water of the lake was also used for drinking in the Golconda fort. One can indulge in various activities like pedal boating, camping, as well as trekking around the lake. Location: Road Number 46, Masthan Nagar, CBI Colony, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500033. Timings: 10 AM to 6 PM. Famous For: It is famous for being a weekend getaway among friends and families. Built By: Mohammad Quli Qutub Shah. Built In: 1518. Tip: Make sure you are wearing comfortable clothes if you plan to go for a hike. TripAdvisor Reviews.
19.summary: Durgam Cheruvu, located on Road Number 46, Masthan Nagar, CBI Colony, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, is a hidden lake spread across 63 acres. Surrounded by granite rocks around 2500 million years old, it offers activities like pedal boating, camping, and trekking. Open from 10 AM to 6 PM, it is a popular weekend getaway for friends and families. Comfortable clothes are recommended for hiking.

20.context: Chilkur Balaji Temple Radiating Divinity Located around 30 km from the main city of Hyderabad, the Chilkur Balaji Temple is an ancient temple situated in a small village named Chilkur. Resting on the banks of Osman Sagar Lake, this temple is commonly called the Visa Balaji Temple. This is quite a popular temple at the outskirts of the city where hundreds of devotees arrive every year with their wishes. Location: Chanda Nagar Village, Hyderabad, Telangana 501504, India. Timings: 6 AM to 8 PM. Famous For: It is famous for clearing USA visas for many, intriguing right? Built By: Akkanna and Madanna. Built In: NA. Tip: Board the Bus No. 288D in order to reach the temple when in Hyderabad. TripAdvisor Reviews.
20.summary: Chilkur Balaji Temple, also known as Visa Balaji Temple, is located in Chanda Nagar Village, Hyderabad. Situated on the banks of Osman Sagar Lake, it is a popular temple for devotees seeking blessings for US visas. Open from 6 AM to 8 PM, it was built by Akkanna and Madanna. Use Bus No. 288D to reach the temple.

21.context: Taj Falaknuma Palace Embellished with Opulence Often called the mirror of the sky, Taj Falaknuma Palace is a magnificent architecture that stands at the height of a high hill. Located just 5 km away from Charminar, this majestic palace was built by Nawab. Spread across an area of 32 acres, this palace is made of marble. With accommodation of 22 halls and 220 rooms, this place also has an impressive library, magnificent chandeliers, and a staircase made of marble. In 2000, this historic palace was taken over by the Taj Group and converted into a luxury hotel. Falaknuma Palace Dinner will be one of the most luxurious experiences of your life. Location: Engine Bowli, Falaknuma, Hyderabad, Telangana 500053, India. Timings: 24 hours. Famous For: It is famous for being a historically significant building that is now a five-star hotel. Built By: William Mard Marret. Built In: 3 March 1884. Tip: If traveling by plane, book your airport transfers beforehand. TripAdvisor Reviews.
21.summary: Taj Falaknuma Palace, located in Engine Bowli, Falaknuma, Hyderabad, is a luxurious hotel set in a 32-acre marble palace built in 1884 by William Mard Marret. Situated 5 km from Charminar, it features 22 halls, 220 rooms, an impressive library, and magnificent chandeliers. Open 24 hours, it offers a lavish experience with pre-booked airport transfers recommended.

22.context: Gandipet Lake Experience Tranquillity Gandipet Lake is the main reservoir of the twin cities Hyderabad and Secunderabad. The lake is spread across a region of 46 km²; this was built by the Hyderabadi Nizam Mir Osman Ali Khan to protect the land from the floods. Made in the year 1920, standing at this reservoir one can enjoy a scenic sunset. Location: Ranga Reddy district, Telangana, India. Famous For: It is famous for bird watching and witnessing beautiful landscapes. Built By: Mir Osman Ali Khan. Built In: 1920. Tip: It is a popular picnic spot. Make sure you spend enough time soaking in the beauty of this lake. TripAdvisor Reviews.
22.summary: Gandipet Lake, located in the Ranga Reddy district, Telangana, is the main reservoir for Hyderabad and Secunderabad. Built in 1920 by Mir Osman Ali Khan to prevent flooding, it covers 46 km². Famous for bird watching and beautiful landscapes, it's a popular picnic spot perfect for enjoying scenic sunsets.

23.context: Mount Opera Loaded with Fun Mount Opera is an exciting and entertaining water park located in the main city of Hyderabad. Just 4 km away from the Ramoji Film City, this place is a great escape for a family day out. Located at a hilltop, this water park offers exciting activities like boating, rain dance, and discotheque, which makes the night more thrilling. Location: Batasingaram, Highway Ranga Reddy District, Hyderabad, Telangana 501528, India. Timings: 11 AM to 6 PM. Famous For: It is famous for being the only waterpark situated atop a hill. Built By: Shivam Amusements Pvt. Ltd. Built In: 1991. Tip: Wear comfortable clothes for dry rides. Avoid dresses and skirts. TripAdvisor Reviews.
23.summary: Mount Opera, located in Batasingaram, Highway Ranga Reddy District, Hyderabad, is a hilltop water park built in 1991 by Shivam Amusements Pvt. Ltd. Just 4 km from Ramoji Film City, it offers boating, rain dance, and a discotheque. Open from 11 AM to 6 PM, wear comfortable clothes for dry rides, avoiding dresses and skirts.

24.context: Paigah Tombs Stunning Architecture The Paigah tombs reflect the beautiful blend of Asaf Jah and Rajputi style in its architecture. Located just 10 km away from Charminar, these tombs are a perfect example of the architecture. Built of marble and with mesmerizing interiors, the tombs also showcase the beautiful Jaali work at the windows. Location: Qalandar Nagar Rd, Santosh Nagar, Kanchan Bagh, Hyderabad, Telangana 500058, India. Timings: 10 AM to 6 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its architecture and the interiors made of mosaic tiles. Built By: Nawab Taig Jung Bahadur. Built In: 1787. Tip: Do not litter when strolling around the tomb. TripAdvisor Reviews.
24.summary: Paigah Tombs, located on Qalandar Nagar Rd, Santosh Nagar, Kanchan Bagh, Hyderabad, is a blend of Asaf Jah and Rajputi architectural styles. Built in 1787 by Nawab Taig Jung Bahadur, these marble tombs feature intricate Jaali work and mosaic tile interiors. Open from 10 AM to 6 PM, visitors should avoid littering.

25.context: Taramati Baradari Majestic Interiors Taramati Baradari is located outside the Golconda Fort on the Gandipet Road. This is one of the most popular historic places in Hyderabad and comprises a music hall with 12 entrances. The legendary artist Taramathi used to perform here. It is said that Taramati and Premamati were the most popular artists during the reign of Abdullah Qutub Shah. Location: Ramdev Guda, Ibrahim Bagh, Hyderabad, Telangana 500031, India. Timings: 11 AM to 6 PM. Famous For: It is famous for exhibiting the Persian-style architecture. Built By: Ibrahim Quli Qutub Shah. Built In: 1880s. Tip: You can cover this spot when you visit the Golconda Fort. You do not have to plan another trip to the Baradari. TripAdvisor Reviews.
25.summary: Taramati Baradari, located on Gandipet Road, Ramdev Guda, Ibrahim Bagh, Hyderabad, is a historic music hall with 12 entrances built in the 1880s by Ibrahim Quli Qutub Shah. Famous for Persian-style architecture, it was a performance venue for artists Taramathi and Premamati. Open from 11 AM to 6 PM, it can be visited along with Golconda Fort.

26.context: Tank Bund A Refreshing Evening Escape Tank Bund connects Hyderabad to Secunderabad and is a popular hangout spot located in the city. The place showcases mesmerizing views of the majestic Hussain Sagar Lake with a monolith of Buddha in the centre. The entire area of Tank Bund comprises 33 bronze statues of popular figures including Nannaya, Tikkana, Erra Pragada, Shri Krishna Devaraya, and many more. Location: Hyderabad, Telangana, India. Timings: 24 hours. Famous For: It is famous for connecting the two parts of the city, Hyderabad and Secunderabad. Built By: Hazrat Hussain Shah Wali. Built In: 1563. Tip: Drive around the dam during the sunset to witness its beauty at its best. TripAdvisor Reviews.
26.summary: Tank Bund, connecting Hyderabad and Secunderabad, is a popular hangout spot offering mesmerizing views of Hussain Sagar Lake and a Buddha monolith. Built by Hazrat Hussain Shah Wali in 1563, it features 33 bronze statues of notable figures. Open 24 hours, it's best enjoyed during sunset.

27.context: Necklace Road Prepossessing Views Inspired by the Queen’s Necklace of Mumbai, this amazing Necklace Road stretches for over 3 km connecting NTR Gardens, Lumbini Park, and Sanjeevaiah Park. The shape of this road is like a necklace and the surrounding Hussain Sagar Lake beautifies this road. Don’t forget to drive thru this stunning road while staying in Hyderabad for a perfect vacation. Location: Hyderabad, Telangana, India. Timings: 24 hours. Famous For: It is famous for connecting popular attractions in the shape of a necklace. Built By: NA. Built In: NA. Tip: There is a pitstop along the road where you can try Go Karting. TripAdvisor Reviews.
27.summary: Necklace Road in Hyderabad, inspired by Mumbai's Queen's Necklace, stretches over 3 km connecting NTR Gardens, Lumbini Park, and Sanjeevaiah Park. Shaped like a necklace and beautified by Hussain Sagar Lake, it is a must-drive location open 24 hours. Try Go Karting at a pitstop along the road.

28.context: Sanghi Temple Seek Blessings Sanghi Temple is a beautiful temple nearly 25 km away from Hyderabad and is dedicated to Lord Venkateshwara. Located on the Paramanand Giri, this temple exhibits the architectural style of the Chola-Chalukya dynasty. The temple complex also comprises temples of other Hindu deities including Parvathy, Ganesha, Rama, etc. The garden next to the temple is known for the vibrant collection of floras. Location: Omerkhan daira, Hyderabad, Telangana 501511, India. Timings: 6 AM to 8 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its architectural beauty and vibrant gardens. Built By: Sanghi Group. Built In: 1991. Tip: Make sure you are dressed modestly for the temple. TripAdvisor Reviews.
28.summary: Sanghi Temple, located in Omerkhan Daira, Hyderabad, is dedicated to Lord Venkateshwara and showcases Chola-Chalukya architectural style. Built by the Sanghi Group in 1991, it features temples of other Hindu deities and vibrant gardens. Open from 6 AM to 8 PM, visitors should dress modestly.

29.context: KBR National Park For Nature Lovers KBR National Park is one of the largest national parks in Telangana and exhibits a vibrant collection of flora and fauna. From lush green environments to the energetic chirping of birds, this astounding National Park is truly a delight for nature enthusiasts. Location: Road Number 2, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500034. Timings: 5:30 AM to 10 AM, 4:30 PM to 7 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its lush green diversity of flora and exotic fauna. Built By: Prince Azam Jah. Built In: 1967. Tip: Do not play around with the wildlife in this National Park. TripAdvisor Reviews.
29.summary: KBR National Park, located on Road Number 2, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, is one of Telangana's largest national parks, featuring diverse flora and fauna. Built by Prince Azam Jah in 1967, it offers lush green environments and bird watching. Open from 5:30 AM to 10 AM and 4:30 PM to 7 PM, visitors should respect wildlife.

30.context: Wonderla Amusement Park An Exhilarating Experience One of the best places to visit in Hyderabad is Wonderla Amusement Park, where you can enjoy multiple fun rides. One can easily spend an entire day at Wonderla with friends and family. The atmosphere is cheerful and happening, and people are high on fun. If you do not have a fear of heights, then you should definitely come to this place on your trip to Hyderabad. Location: Nehru Outer Ring Rd, Exit No. 13, Ravirala, Hyderabad, Telangana 501510. Timings: 11 AM to 6 PM. Famous For: It is famous for offering the best amusement park experience to kids and adults. Built By: Wonderla Holidays. Built In: 2016. Tip: Get a fast track ticket to skip the long queues. TripAdvisor Reviews.
30.summary: Wonderla Amusement Park, located on Nehru Outer Ring Rd, Exit No. 13, Ravirala, Hyderabad, offers a thrilling experience with multiple fun rides. Built by Wonderla Holidays in 2016, it's perfect for a full day with friends and family. Open from 11 AM to 6 PM, fast track tickets are recommended to avoid queues.

31.context: Sudha’s Car Museum Intriguing Handmade Cars Sudha’s Car Museum is not an unusual place to visit if you like cars and automobiles. It is one of the most amazing places to see in Hyderabad where you will find a number of handmade cars on display. You will also find information like the year of manufacture and cost of every exhibit. The museum was started by Kanyaboyina Sudhakar who had an interest in cars since childhood. The museum was opened in 2010 and has been attracting car enthusiasts ever since. Location: Bahadurpura X Road, APHB Colony, Bahadurpura, West Hyderabad, Telangana 500064. Timings: 9:30 AM to 6:30 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its impeccable collection of vintage cars. Built By: K. Sudhakar. Built In: 2010. Tip: All car enthusiasts should definitely pay a visit to this museum. TripAdvisor Reviews.
31.summary: Sudha’s Car Museum, located at Bahadurpura X Road, APHB Colony, Bahadurpura, West Hyderabad, Telangana, features a collection of handmade and vintage cars. Opened in 2010 by K. Sudhakar, it provides detailed information about each exhibit. Open from 9:30 AM to 6:30 PM, it's a must-visit for car enthusiasts.

32.context: Sri Jagannath Temple Fascinating Infrastructure One of the most beautiful tourist spots in Hyderabad is Sri Jagannath Temple. It is a modern temple located in Banjara Hills. The temple is built by the Odia community and has been dedicated to Lord Jagannath, the God of the Universe. You will be mesmerized by the shikhara style pattern of the temple. There are also Shrines dedicated to Lakshmi, Shiva, Ganesha, Hanuman, and Navagraha. Location: Plot 1269, Road No. 12, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500034. Timings: 6 AM to 12 PM, 5 PM to 9 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its annual Rathyatra festival. Built By: Kalinga Cultural Trust. Built In: 2009. Tip: Make sure you visit around the annual Rathyatra festival. TripAdvisor Reviews.
32.summary: Sri Jagannath Temple, located at Plot 1269, Road No. 12, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, is a modern temple dedicated to Lord Jagannath and built by the Odia community in 2009. Open from 6 AM to 12 PM and 5 PM to 9 PM, it features shikhara style architecture and shrines to other deities. Visit during the annual Rathyatra festival.

33.context: Nizam’s Museum Depicting Luxury If you are visiting Charminar, then you should make a stop by Nizam’s Museum that is located in the heart of Purani Haveli. Get an insight into the royal life of the Nizam of Hyderabad and how lavishly he lived. You will find artifacts and articles from his life on display. From the fancy clothes to utensils, Nizam sure knew how to live a life of luxury and opulence. It is one of the most famous places in Hyderabad to visit on your trip. Location: Purani Haveli, Pathar Gatti, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002. Timings: 10 AM to 5 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its collection of items that once served as gifts to the last Nizam of Hyderabad. Built By: Nawab Mir Mahboob Ali Khan. Built In: 1936. Tip: Capture some of the beautiful souvenirs in your camera. TripAdvisor Reviews.
33.summary: Nizam’s Museum, located in Purani Haveli, Pathar Gatti, Hyderabad, showcases the luxurious life of the last Nizam of Hyderabad. Built in 1936 by Nawab Mir Mahboob Ali Khan, it displays artifacts and articles from his life. Open from 10 AM to 5 PM, visitors should capture the beautiful souvenirs.

34.context: ISKCON Temple Sparkling with Spirituality ISKCON Temples are known for being beautiful and spiritual all over the world. If ISKCON is your home for spirituality, then you will find one in the Nampally region in Hyderabad. The beautiful idols of Sri Sri Jagannatha and Sri Radha are so beautiful to look at. Don’t forget to attend the Aarti because it is one of the most beautiful experiences. It is one of the best places to visit in Hyderabad in the evening. Location: Nampally Station Road, Sri Sri Radha Madanmohan Mandir, Hare Krishna Land, Abids, Hyderabad, Telangana 500001. Timings: 4:30 AM to 1 PM, 4 PM to 9 PM. Famous For: It is famous for the temple’s devotion to Lord Krishna. Built By: Bhaktivedanta Swami Srila Prabhupada. Built In: NA. Tip: This temple does not allow food inside, especially if it has onion and garlic. TripAdvisor Reviews.
34.summary: ISKCON Temple, located on Nampally Station Road, Sri Sri Radha Madanmohan Mandir, Hare Krishna Land, Abids, Hyderabad, is a spiritual center dedicated to Lord Krishna. With beautiful idols of Sri Jagannatha and Sri Radha, it offers a memorable Aarti experience. Open from 4:30 AM to 1 PM and 4 PM to 9 PM, food with onion and garlic is not allowed.

35.context: Madina Market Every Shopaholic’s Dream Madina Market is a textile market in Hyderabad, and if you are looking to shop for clothes, then this is where you should head on your trip to the city. It is a great place to buy items at wholesale prices. Location: Patel Market, Rikab Gunj, Ghansi Bazaar, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002. Timings: 10 AM to 11 PM. Famous For: It is famous for traditional Hyderabadi outfits. Built By: NA. Built In: 1938. Tip: Carry a bag to keep the things you splurge on. TripAdvisor Reviews.
35.summary: Madina Market, located in Patel Market, Rikab Gunj, Ghansi Bazaar, Hyderabad, is a textile market known for traditional Hyderabadi outfits. Established in 1938, it's a great place for buying clothes at wholesale prices. Open from 10 AM to 11 PM, visitors should carry a bag for their purchases.

36.context: Paigah Palace Marvellous Architecture The Paigah family came next in hierarchy to the ruling family of Nizams. The Paigahs were also the first palace builders of Hyderabad. Paigah Palace was built by a Paigah nobleman Sir Vicar-ul-Umra after he gave the beautiful Falaknuma Palace to the sixth Nizam of Hyderabad. This beautiful palace was built in the early 1900s. Its architecture has led the place to land among the top places to visit in Hyderabad. Location: Begumpet, Hyderabad, Telangana, India. Timings: 10 AM to 5 PM. Famous For: It is famous for its charm that it exudes from every nook. Built By: Sir Vicar-ul-Umra. Built In: Early 1900s. Tip: You can plan a great Royal wedding affair at this destination. TripAdvisor Reviews.
36.summary: Paigah Palace, located in Begumpet, Hyderabad, was built in the early 1900s by Sir Vicar-ul-Umra after gifting Falaknuma Palace to the sixth Nizam. Known for its charming architecture, it is one of the top places to visit in Hyderabad. Open from 10 AM to 5 PM, it is a great venue for a Royal wedding.

37.context: GVK One Mall Fun One of the best places to visit in Hyderabad for shopping is GVK One Mall. Spread over an area of 3.5 lakh square feet, this is a spectacular mall located in the posh area of Banjara Hills. So if you are planning to shop while in Hyderabad, check out this stunning mall. Location: Rd Number 1, Balapur Basthi, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 500034. Timings: 10:30 AM to 10 PM. Famous For: It is famous for high-end brands like Charles & Keith, Calvin Klein, and more. Built By: GVK Group. Built In: 1 May 2009. Tip: You can have a great time if you go with your friends and family. TripAdvisor Reviews.
37.summary: GVK One Mall, located on Rd Number 1, Balapur Basthi, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, is a premier shopping destination. Spread over 3.5 lakh square feet and built by GVK Group in 2009, it features high-end brands like Charles & Keith and Calvin Klein. Open from 10:30 AM to 10 PM, it is perfect for shopping with friends and family.

38.context: Osman Sagar Lake Views One of the best tourist places in Hyderabad is Osman Sagar Lake. The lake not only offers picturesque views and experiences but is also surrounded by famous entertainment sources like Treasure Island and Ocean Park, which make it a destination worth visiting. Location: Ranga Reddy district, Telangana, India. Famous For: It is famous for protecting the city from floods. Built By: Mir Osman Ali Khan. Built In: 1920. Tip: Try going to the lake early in the morning to enjoy the surreal views. TripAdvisor Reviews.
38.summary: Osman Sagar Lake, located in Ranga Reddy district, Telangana, is renowned for its picturesque views and entertainment options like Treasure Island and Ocean Park. Built by Mir Osman Ali Khan in 1920, it also protects the city from floods. Visit early in the morning for the best experience.

39.context: Nagarjuna Sagar Dam Views This is one of the world’s largest dams, whose sight will leave you jaw-dropped. The dam has as many as 26 gates and is 124 meters tall. It is surrounded by lush greenery, which makes it one of the best tourist places in Hyderabad. People visit the dam to marvel at its magnificence and magnanimous structure. Location: Guntur district, Andhra Pradesh, and Nalgonda district, Telangana. Timings: 9 AM to 9 PM. Famous For: It is famous for playing a crucial role in irrigation in Andhra Pradesh. Built By: Raja Of Muktyala. Built In: 1955. Tip: You can take a bus to Nagarjuna bus stand to reach this destination. TripAdvisor Reviews.
39.summary: Nagarjuna Sagar Dam, located in Guntur district, Andhra Pradesh, and Nalgonda district, Telangana, is one of the world's largest dams with 26 gates and a height of 124 meters. Built by the Raja Of Muktyala in 1955, it plays a crucial role in irrigation. Open from 9 AM to 9 PM, take a bus to Nagarjuna bus stand for access.

40.context: Inorbit Mall For Shopping Fun If you are done with sightseeing in Hyderabad, then head to this mall. Inorbit Mall is one of the biggest malls in Hyderabad, home to numerous brands, eateries, and recreational activities. It is listed among places to visit in Hyderabad, so make sure you visit it during your trip. Location: Hitech City, Hyderabad. Timings: 11 AM to 9:30 PM. Famous For: It is famous for being home to global brands, international café chains, and gaming zones. Built By: K. Raheja Corporation and Evo Enterprises. Built In: 2004. Tip: This is a perfect spot for women to enjoy shopping from global brands. TripAdvisor Reviews.
40.summary: Inorbit Mall, located in Hitech City, Hyderabad, is one of the city's largest malls featuring global brands, international café chains, and gaming zones. Built by K. Raheja Corporation and Evo Enterprises in 2004, it is open from 11 AM to 9:30 PM and is ideal for shopping enthusiasts.

41.context: Peddamma Temple Stunning Architecture Peddamma Temple is one of the most beautiful places to see in Hyderabad where you can make your wishes and seek prayers. The temple offers architectural beauty and a peaceful atmosphere. If you are looking for peace and tranquility, then this is among the best places to visit in Hyderabad. Location: Jagadish Nagar, Begumpet, Hyderabad, Telangana 500003. Timings: Open 24 hours. Famous For: It is famous for its architectural beauty and stunning interiors. Built By: P. Janardhan Reddy. Built In: 1993. Tip: Try visiting the temple during the celebrations of Bonalu. TripAdvisor Reviews.
41.summary: Peddamma Temple, located in Jagadish Nagar, Begumpet, Hyderabad, is known for its stunning architecture and peaceful atmosphere. Built by P. Janardhan Reddy in 1993, it is open 24 hours. Visit during the Bonalu celebrations for a special experience.

42.context: Sri Rama Chandra Swamy Temple An Ancient Temple Another religious place to visit in Hyderabad is Sri Rama Chandra Swamy Temple, located in the serene village of Ammapali. The temple is believed to be 800 years old and has played a significant role in the history of the area. The monument of the temple is believed to be older than the Golconda Fort and exhibits Rajasthani-style architecture that comprises a step well and gopuram. This is among the best Hyderabad tourist places. Location: Nagarguda, Shamshabad Rd, Near Rajeev Gandhi International Airport, Telangana 501218. Timings: 6 AM to 1 PM and 4 PM to 8 PM. Famous For: It is a popular spot for film shoots of Tollywood movies. Built By: Vengi kings. Built In: 13th century. Tip: Do not forget to carry your cameras. TripAdvisor Reviews.
42.summary: Sri Rama Chandra Swamy Temple, located in Nagarguda, Shamshabad Rd, near Rajeev Gandhi International Airport, Telangana, is an 800-year-old temple with Rajasthani-style architecture. Built by the Vengi kings in the 13th century, it is a popular spot for Tollywood film shoots. Open from 6 AM to 1 PM and 4 PM to 8 PM, bring your cameras.

43.context: Charminar Bazaar Explore the Charm One of the finest Hyderabad tourist spots, we welcome you to one of the most affordable markets that sits every Sunday where you can shop loads even with a restricted budget. The bazaar carries a distinctive character that clearly demarcates the Nizami influence of the city. Be it the items that are sold or the street food, you will feel the charm of an old city much like the markets of Chandni Chowk in Delhi. Get the fresh aroma of kebabs, Irani chai, the glittery glass bangles, and everything that excites a budget shopaholic. The certain culture makes it one of the best places to visit in Hyderabad with friends. Location: Laad Bazaar Road, Mitti Ka Sher, Charminar, Lad Bazar, Hyderabad, Telangana 500002. Timings: 11 AM to 11 PM. Famous For: Really affordable handicrafts. Built By: NA. Built In: NA. Tip: Do not forget to try the Irani chai with Osmania biscuits.
43.summary: Charminar Bazaar, located on Laad Bazaar Road, Mitti Ka Sher, Charminar, Lad Bazar, Hyderabad, Telangana, is a vibrant market open from 11 AM to 11 PM. Known for affordable handicrafts, kebabs, Irani chai, and glass bangles, it reflects the Nizami influence. It's a budget-friendly shopping destination, perfect for friends.

44.context: Begum Bazaar Relish the Vibrant Aura Begum Bazaar is the biggest commercial market in Hyderabad located close to the old city. The market is mostly flocked by locals citing retail and wholesale items for home. Yes, it’s true that it might not top the list of top Hyderabad tourist spots, yet there is some charm in it. The market also has one of the second largest fish markets in Hyderabad. Location: Afzal Gunj, Hyderabad, Telangana 500012. Timings: 10 AM to 11 PM. Famous For: The fish market selling a variety of fish hatched from the nearby regions. Built By: Humda Begum. Built In: 1812. Tip: Keep loads of cash as online payment isn’t the trend here.
44.summary: Begum Bazaar, located in Afzal Gunj, Hyderabad, Telangana, is the city's largest commercial market, open from 10 AM to 11 PM. Built by Humda Begum in 1812, it features one of Hyderabad's largest fish markets. It is popular for retail and wholesale shopping. Carry cash, as online payments are uncommon.

45.context: Ocean Park For a Good Time Welcome to the sprawling waterpark quite popular as one of the top Hyderabad tourist spots for its recreational capability. Expect a full day of entertainment and fun while the cool water in summers gushes past you. The park is segmented into 2 sections: an entire area is dedicated to water sports, while another area is solely reserved for amusement games. Hands down, this is one of the best Hyderabad sightseeing options if you are traveling with family and also one of the most sought after places to visit in summer in Hyderabad. Location: H. No. Survey No. 166, 167, 168, 169, Shankarpalli Rd, near CBIT College, Gandipet, Hyderabad, Telangana 500075. Timings: 11 AM to 7:30 PM. Famous For: Amusement rides, restaurants serving food at affordable prices. Built By: NA. Built In: NA. Tip: Outside garments are not allowed. You have to wear swimming costumes provided by authorities.
45.summary: Ocean Park, located at Survey No. 166, 167, 168, 169, Shankarpalli Rd, near CBIT College, Gandipet, Hyderabad, Telangana, is a popular waterpark offering water sports and amusement games. Open from 11 AM to 7:30 PM, it features amusement rides and affordable restaurants. Visitors must wear provided swimming costumes.

46.context: Botanical Garden Nature’s Splendour Every major city in India has a botanical garden, and Hyderabad cannot be far behind. After all, there are many reasons to love Hyderabad, be it the tourist attractions, culture, street food, or affordable shopping destinations. The Hyderabad Botanical Gardens is one such open area you will definitely desire to visit, citing the rejuvenation appeal. The land of the garden is protected by the Kothaguda Reserve Forest area. Spread across a massive 120 acres, this is the place to be in Hyderabad after a tiring day at the office or if you like to relax within the greenery. Location: Kothaguda Reserve Forest, Gachibowli Road, Near HiTech City, Kondapur, Hyderabad, Telangana 500032. Timings: 9 AM to 7:30 PM. Famous For: The varied species of flora on display and relaxing in the bliss. Built By: Telangana Forest Department. Built In: 2018. Tip: Do not pluck any flowers as they are nature’s property.
46.summary: Botanical Garden, located in Kothaguda Reserve Forest, Gachibowli Road, Near HiTech City, Kondapur, Hyderabad, Telangana, is a rejuvenating 120-acre area with varied flora species. Established by the Telangana Forest Department in 2018, it's open from 9 AM to 7:30 PM. Visitors should avoid plucking flowers.

47.context: Moazzam Jahi Market Reflecting Hyderabad’s Culture Another place in the city which clearly indicates the style and grandeur of the Nizams is the Moazzam Jahi Market. The market, mostly known for selling fruits in the beginning, now has almost everything you can expect from a market, including vegetables, groceries, flowers, earthen pots, dry fruits, and ittar. The market was once a place that might have helped make it to the top Hyderabad sightseeing destinations, but since the 1980s, it has been dismantled, and several specialties have been shifted to other markets. Still, it stands tall and is one of the ideal places to visit in Hyderabad with friends. Location: JN Road, Chandra Vihar, Old Kattal Mandi, Abids, Hyderabad, Telangana 500001. Timings: 9 AM to 11 PM. Famous For: The culture that it has preserved throughout the years. Built By: Mir Osman Ali Khan. Built In: 1935. Tip: Carry cash if you want to buy something.
47.summary: Moazzam Jahi Market, located on JN Road, Chandra Vihar, Old Kattal Mandi, Abids, Hyderabad, Telangana, is known for its diverse offerings, from fruits to dry fruits and ittar. Built by Mir Osman Ali Khan in 1935, it reflects the grandeur of the Nizams. Open from 9 AM to 11 PM, carry cash for purchases.

48.context: Nalgonda An Ancient City Sumukh Teja Vanamala for Wikimedia Commons An ideal place for history buffs, Nalgonda is an ancient city located near Hyderabad. With pristine waterfall cascades and ancient forts, this city is one of the best places in Hyderabad for an enriching historic tour and memorable experience. It is to be noted that Nalgonda is as ancient as the Palaeolithic Age and is home to an array of popular tourist attractions. Undeniably, it is one of the best tourist places near Hyderabad. Location: 90 kms from Hyderabad. Famous For: Nagarjuna Sagar Dam. Built By: NA. Built In: NA. Tip: A perfect place to visit with family and friends. Enjoy backpacking, trekking, and sightseeing in the city.
48.summary: Nalgonda, located 90 km from Hyderabad, is an ancient city ideal for history buffs. Known for pristine waterfalls and ancient forts, it dates back to the Palaeolithic Age. Popular tourist attractions include Nagarjuna Sagar Dam. It's perfect for family and friends to enjoy backpacking, trekking, and sightseeing.

49.context: Mahabubnagar Haven for History Buffs Naidugari Jayanna for Wikimedia Commons A popular historical destination near Hyderabad, Mahabubnagar is known as the land of the Chola Dynasty. One of the most ancient places in South India, the city is a haven for history lovers. With a plethora of historic sites and tourist attractions such as Jama Masjid, Medina Masjid, and Mecca Masjid, this city is a place near Hyderabad. Location: 98 km away from Hyderabad. Famous For: Jama Masjid, Mecca Masjid, and Medina Masjid. Built By: NA. Built In: NA. Tip: Visit this place from October to March to avoid the summer heat.
49.summary: Mahabubnagar, located 98 km from Hyderabad, is an ancient city known for its historical significance. It is famous for sites like Jama Masjid, Medina Masjid, and Mecca Masjid. Ideal for history lovers, it is best visited from October to March to avoid the summer heat.

50.context: Jewel Of Nizam The Minar Dine Around Opulence Dipped in royalty, this luxurious dining place is for the ones who wish to indulge in a lavish dining experience and treat their taste palettes. It’s a perfect haven for couples as well as families wanting to be pampered by rich cuisines along with an opulent ambiance. The marvelous entries will definitely make one fall for this wonderful place. Location: The Golkonda Resorts & Spa, The Golkonda Resorts & Spa, Sagarmahal Complex, Hyderabad. Foods: Lamb Biryani, Apricot Pudding, Veg Shorba, Tomato Shorba. Timings: 12:30 PM to 3 PM, 7 PM to 11 PM. Tip: Don’t forget to gorge on Hyderabadi and Mughlai cuisine here. Cost For Two: INR 2500 approximately.
50.summary: Jewel Of Nizam, located at The Golkonda Resorts & Spa, Sagarmahal Complex, Hyderabad, offers a luxurious dining experience with rich cuisines in an opulent ambiance. Open from 12:30 PM to 3 PM and 7 PM to 11 PM, it's perfect for couples and families. Must-try dishes include Lamb Biryani and Apricot Pudding.

51.context: Paradise Biryani Biryani Lovers’ Sweet Retreat All the Biryani lovers, this is the place to be. Offering the most delicious biryani in Hyderabad is this Paradise Biryani, which speaks volumes of its traditional values. Apart from offering Hyderabadi biryani, it services various other cuisines as well that are definitely worth a try. The chefs here make sure to lend each dish an authentic taste. Frequently visited by both locals as well as tourists, this eatery should be visited by all gastronomes. Location: Paradise Circle, Hyderabad. Foods: Mutton Biryani, Mirchi Salan, Chicken Hara Bhara Kebab, Chicken Dum Biryani. Timings: 11 AM to 11 PM. Tip: Don’t forget to try various kinds of biryani here. Cost For Two: INR 800.
51.summary: Paradise Biryani, located at Paradise Circle, Hyderabad, is famous for its traditional Hyderabadi biryani and other authentic cuisines. Open from 11 AM to 11 PM, it is frequented by locals and tourists. Must-try dishes include Mutton Biryani and Chicken Dum Biryani. Cost for two is approximately INR 800.

52.context: Kismet A Party Animals’ Den One of the best tourist places in Hyderabad, Kismet is the ultimate stop for all party lovers. With a lively ambiance accompanied by some toothsome meals and drinks to die for, this place will let you enter into a different world altogether. Especially if you wish to enjoy the nightlife of Hyderabad, this place very well deserves your visit. Be it the music, staff, lights, atmosphere, foods, or drinks, everything here is up to the mark, and that is why it is one of the best places in Hyderabad. Location: The Park Hotel, 22, 1st Floor, Raj Bhavan Road, Somajiguda. Foods: Cocktails, Snacks, Pepper Prawns, Drinks, Starters. Timings: 8 PM till midnight. Tip: If you want to witness the vivid nightlife of Hyderabad, visit here. Cost For Two: INR 3000 approximately.
52.summary: Kismet, located at The Park Hotel, 1st Floor, Raj Bhavan Road, Somajiguda, Hyderabad, is a top destination for party lovers. With lively ambiance, great music, and delicious food and drinks, it is perfect for experiencing Hyderabad's nightlife. Open from 8 PM till midnight, cost for two is approximately INR 3000.

53.context: Coco’s Bar And Grill For Soothing All Senses Boasting a cozy and quaint ambiance, this place is ideal for casual dining with friends and family. From Italian to North Indian and from Continental to Chinese, you will find all the common cuisines here loved by the visitors. With a separate bar space as well as smoke space, it makes a great spot for individuals to hang out and chill. Moreover, the live music over the rooftop area enhances its overall charm. Location: Plot 217, Opposite KBR Park, Beside TDP Office, Road 2, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad. Foods: Thai Roast Chicken, Chilli Cheese Toast, Ravioli, Chicken Lasagna. Timings: 7 PM till midnight. Tip: If you wish to take your partner here, visit in the evening during live performances. Cost For Two: INR 1700.
53.summary: Coco’s Bar And Grill, located at Plot 217, Opposite KBR Park, Beside TDP Office, Road 2, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, offers a cozy ambiance for casual dining with friends and family. With a variety of cuisines and live rooftop music, it is open from 7 PM till midnight. Cost for two is approximately INR 1700.

54.context: Amnesia Lounge Bar And Club For Ultimate Culinary Experience Yet another place for live entertainment and oodles of relaxation, Amnesia Lounge Bar and Club is one of the most visited places in Hyderabad. You can treat your taste buds with varied cuisines including Chinese, American, Continental, Italian, and North Indian. While bragging about amazing night music, zealous DJ, and refreshing cocktails and mocktails, this place leaves no stone unturned to give its visitors an ultimate refreshing time. Location: Plot 1102, 5th Floor, Jaya Chambers, Road 36, Jubilee Hills. Foods: Tandoori Veg Platter, Whiskey Cocktail, Corn Kernels, Chicken Popcorn, Chilli Mushroom. Timings: 7 PM till midnight. Tip: Don’t forget to enjoy the night entertainment here. Cost For Two: INR 1300.
54.summary: Amnesia Lounge Bar And Club, located at Plot 1102, 5th Floor, Jaya Chambers, Road 36, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, is known for live entertainment and varied cuisines. With amazing night music, DJ, cocktails, and mocktails, it is perfect for relaxation. Open from 7 PM till midnight, cost for two is approximately INR 1300.
